conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun involves a projectile moving between two parallel rails with current generating a magnetic field, propelling the projectile due to Lorentz force.
Xiao Ming purchased a railgun model with specific parameters: rail length (0.5 m), rail spacing (0.02 m), projectile mass (0.02 kg), rail current (10 A), and magnetic field strength (1 T).
Calculate the Lorentz force acting on the projectile using the formula F = I * L * B, resulting in F = 5 N.
Determine the acceleration of the projectile using Newton's second law, resulting in a = 250 m/s^2.
Calculate the final velocity of the projectile using the kinematic equation, resulting in v ≈ 15.81 m/s.
Calculate the kinetic energy of the projectile using the formula K = 1/2 * m * v^2, resulting in K = 2.5 J.
Calculate the time taken for the projectile to travel the length of the rails using the kinematic equation, resulting in t ≈ 0.0632 s.
Calculate the power of the electromagnetic railgun using the formula P = K / t, resulting in P ≈ 39.56 W.
The power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is approximately 39.56 W.
